text: hey <@U4K0WAADP> ! we're talking through a plan based on our conversations last week, and wanted to ask you if we'd be able to receive product photography to use as a training set (and - bonus points - if there is any categorizations of this imagery we could leverage. color/product type/etc)
creation + categorization could be a big or small lift based on whats accessible to us, so wanted to get a sense of how we should plan time + team to account for what is realistic

I could  easily get you a copy of our product feed, which contains all all sorts of data for each article on <http://adidas.com|adidas.com>, including the names, colors, categories and url for each of the product images (most have 6 angles). That’s easy to pull for current products, roughly 2800 articles live right now. 

For older products, or things that aren’t carried on our site, I’m not sure how I’d source imagery for those, but I’m sure there’s another system I can pull those from.
